intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. acroleucoides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are spoon-shaped and hairy. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, which bloom from June to August. Its leaves are often covered with fine hairs, and the stems are usually hairy as well. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
